content.description: Climb small crimps to a large hueco. The crux is a few core intensive and balance moves. After the crux, the route turns into easy slab until the top on good chickenheads and flakes.
content.location:
This is very obvious with a large hueco about 20 feet up. It is 5-6 feet right of

Earl Grey

.

content.description: Start on very few crimp holds where you make a few painful moves to a bland crimps until you reach 2nd hanger. Then move over the left face of the wall, and climb on some good holds until you get to the summit standing rock where the anchors are located.
content.location:
It is the farthest route left about 5 feet left of

Tea Bagged

.

content.description: Start at the crack that have some good holds. The crux is off of 2 perfect hand moves to a fist. The holds after that are good. Reach the top, and walk 40ish feet on 3rd to 4th Class slab to anchors.
content.protection: A single set of #1-4 BD C4. There are no anchors at the top. Walk on 4th Class slab to the anchor.
content.location: This is a very noticeable crack on the far left. It has a small boulder just below it.
